pages.title: 404 - An Error code!
pages.content:
Error! Not Found!

Whoops! It looks like something might've been mistyped there. You can try again or take a look at one of the links to the left.

Did you know?

404 is what we call a "response status code." These codes tell your browser how the server handled your request. Most of the time, your browser gets Status Code 200, which means "OK". In other words, the server likes you and it decided to let you see the webpage.
If you've ever attempted to go somewhere where you aren't allowed, your browser likely either received a redirect to a login page, a 4xx error code (like 401 - "Unauthorized" or 403 - "Forbidden"), or maybe both.

And if you've ever sent a requests to a teapot to try and brew coffee, the teapot likely returned a 418—the "I'm a teapot" error code. Yes, that's a real thing.

In this case, it looks like you've stumbled upon 404, which means "Not Found." No worries! This can be easily corrected by typing in the correct URL or navigating to it via the Sitemap or the navigation bar to the left.

pages.title: About BellCube
pages.description: "About Me" for BellCube, a hobbyist video game modder and web developer.
pages.content:
Hello there!

I'm BellCube, a modder who works on Minecraft and various Bethesda games and a moderator at Nexus Mods.
I also like to code stuff. I'm currently learning web development (oh hi) and I'll just learn something else after that.

What I Know

I primarily know TypeScript and Papyrus, though I have some experience with Lua. As for data formats, I can fluently write JSON and YAML, XML, and INI no problem. I can churn out HTML like it's nothing most of the time. CSS occasionally gives me some trouble, but nothing MDN can't fix. I can also write Batch and Powershell scripts relatively well.
If you need someone to right your regex, I'm your guy—I write it like a second language. I can usually figure out any given language if need be, but I prefer to use the ones I already know if possible.

The Bucket List

In no particular order:
  • Getting familiar with databases (e.g. SQL)
  • Learning C#, C++, Rust, and Python
  • Accustoming myself to various JavaScript frameworks
  • Familiarizing myself with the Linux command line


Outside of Programming and Modding

I'm a film student IRL. While I haven't published any work just yet, that may change at some point in the next three years. My all-time favorite game is Hollow Knight—the most perfect game known to man. I've got a backlog longer than the Pacific Ocean and twice as deep (thanks, Nexus!). I'm an English fanatic and can be found occasionally losing my last few drops of sanity over simple things like a missing comma.

Moderation

On March 1st, 2023 at 10:18 AM EST, Nexus' community manager Pickysaurus contacted me via Discord to ask if I was interested in helping moderate Nexus Mods. I said yes after a bit of discussion and was officially knighted on the 6th. I strive to be fair and objective from the moment I open the reports panel, though I'm not perfect. I do my best to always back up my actions with direct citation from official Nexus policies and do my best to ask my fellow moderators and the Community Management team when I'm unsure of something.

Moderation is volunteer work, so I don't get paid for it. I do it because I mainly because I enjoy it, though the want to help make Nexus a better place for everyone certainly doesn't hurt.

If you ever want more information on how I moderate, feel free to ask me about it. I'm always happy to answer as best I can and dig further if I can't!



Current Projects

Fallen-By-The-Wayside Projects

Completed Projects

Archived Projects

Nothing here yet...



Get In Touch

If you want to get in touch with me, you can do so via the following methods:

  • Nexus Mods DMs
  • Discord - BellCube#9773 (you'll have to be in a server with me, such as the Nexus Mods server)

pages.title: LSP - Creating a Plugin
pages.description:
This page describes how to create a plugin for the Linear Spell Progression framework mod. It runs through the basics, such as the structure, all the way down to the standard Editor IDs.
Linear Spell Progression is a Skyrim Special Edition framework mod that allows you to add prerequisites to spells without creating compatibility issues.
pages.content:
The Format

Linear Spell Progression has its own format for plugins. First, download the Plugin Development Kit from releases. Below is an overview of the plugin and a guide to editing it. For testing, use Don't Eat Spell Tomes.

Plugin Structure

The plugin is made of a Package and at least 4 FormLists, arranged in a tree structure.
expand_more

Image Diagram

expand_more

Text Representation

  • Master List (in LinearSpellProgression.esl)
      • YOUR Plugin! (Repeatable)
        1. Spell Tomes
          1. Some Spell Tome (Repeatable)
          2. Some Spell Tome (Repeatable)
          3. Some Spell Tome (Repeatable)
        2. Spells
          1. Matching Spell (repeatable)
          2. Matching Spell (repeatable)
          3. Matching Spell (repeatable)
        3. Prerequisite Spells
          1. Spell 0's Prerequisites
            • Single Spell
            • Requirements List
              • Some Spell (Repeatable)
              • Some Spell (Repeatable)
              • Some Spell (Repeatable)
          2. Spell 1's Prerequisites
            • Single Spell
            • Requirements List
              • Some Spell (Repeatable)
              • Some Spell (Repeatable)
              • Some Spell (Repeatable)
          3. Spell 2's Prerequisites
            • Single Spell
            • Requirements List
              • Some Spell (Repeatable)
              • Some Spell (Repeatable)
              • Some Spell (Repeatable)
        4. Spells
          1. Skill Level Global (repeatable)
          2. Skill Level Global (repeatable)
          3. Skill Level Global (repeatable)

Package??!

A quick look in xEdit shows that the template includes an AI Package??! What in the world? Well, allow me to enlighten you. I've used the Package to hold the script needed to install your plugin. Why not use a Quest, you might ask. Well, I've heard reports about the OnInit() event having oddities and inconsistencies on Quests, and so I opted for another form that can hold scripts—and opted for packages. Because they're not a base object (like an Activator or Static), I don't expect xSE plugins to mess with it (causing a very minor performance hit). And because of its EditorID, I don't expect users to attempt to apply it to an NPC.

The Guide

Alright, so now you know what that's all about. You may even understand this enough to jump in right now! But if you're not, here's what you do:

  1. Rename the plugin file. Don't want a bunch of plugins all called LinearSpellProgression Plugin Template.esp, now do we?
  2. Open the Plugin Template, alongside any plugins you want to add spell prerequisites to, in either SSEEdit (Recommended) or the Creation Kit.
  3. Navigate to the FormLists. If you're doing this in the Creation Kit, you can search by LSP_
  4. Rename the FormLists using the EditorID Scheme below
  5. Balance to your heart's content! Here's how:
    1. Find your Spell Tome. Add it to the Tomes list.
    2. Add its corresponding Spell to the Spells list
    3. Add its prerequisites to the Prerequisites list. This can be EITHER a FormList or a single Spell

    Do note these items' indexes must align. So if the Spell Tome for Fireball is at index 2, the spell Fireball should be at index 2 in the Spells list and the various prerequisites should be at index 2 in the Prerequisites lists.
Simple enough, right? (if you don't think so, think of how annoying this would be to implement on your own)

EditorID Scheme

It's a (relatively) simple system.
  • Universal Ending: [DLC/CC/MOD]{{3-letter abbreviation for author, such as BGS}}_{{2-Digit Number}}{{Human-readable name}}
    Example: DLC_BGS_00Skyrim

  • Plugin-Level: LSP_Main_ + Universal Ending
    Example: LSP_0Tomes_DLC_BGS_00Skyrim

  • Tome: LSP_0Tomes_ + Universal Ending
    Example: LSP_0Tomes_DLC_BGS_00Skyrim

  • * Spells: LSP_1Spells_ + Universal Ending
    Example: LSP_1Spells_DLC_BGS_00Skyrim

  • Prerequisites: LSP_2Pre_ + Universal Ending
    Example: LSP_2Pre_DLC_BGS_00Skyrim

  • List of a single spell's prerequisites: LSP_{{Spell Name}}_ + Universal Ending
    Example: LSP_FlameCloak_DLC_BGS_00Skyrim

Linear Spell Progression is a Skyrim Special Edition framework mod that allows you to add prerequisites to spells without creating compatibility issues.
","content":"<h1>The Format</h1>

Linear Spell Progression has its own format for plugins. First, download the Plugin Development Kit from <a href=\"https://github.com/BellCubeDev/LinearSpellProgression/releases\" target=\"_blank\">releases</a>. Below is an overview of the plugin and a guide to editing it. For testing, use <a href=\"https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrimspecialedition/mods/43095/\" target=\"_blank\">Don't Eat Spell Tomes.</a>

<h2>Plugin Structure</h2>

The plugin is made of a Package and at least 4 FormLists, arranged in a tree structure.

<div class=\"js-bcd-summary\" for=\"docs_lsp_createPlugin_diagram_img\">
    <i class=\"material-icons open-icon-90CC\">expand_more</i>
    <h3>Image Diagram</h3>
</div>
<div class=\"js-bcd-details\" id=\"docs_lsp_createPlugin_diagram_img\">
    <img src=\"https://raw.githubusercontent.com/BellCubeDev/LinearSpellProgression/main/Images/LSP%20Master%20List%20Format.svg\"
        loading=\"lazy\" alt=\"an image-based diagram of the Linear Spell Progression plugin format\" />
</div>
<div class=\"js-bcd-summary\" for=\"docs_lsp_createPlugin_diagram_txt\">
    <i class=\"material-icons open-icon-90CC\">expand_more</i>
    <h3>Text Representation</h3>
</div>
<div class=\"js-bcd-details\" id=\"docs_lsp_createPlugin_diagram_txt\">
    <ul class=\"docs_textDiagram\">
        <li>Master List (in LinearSpellProgression.esl)<ul type=\"disc\">
            <ul>
                <li class=\"docs_textDiagram_repeatable\">YOUR Plugin! (Repeatable)
                    <ol type=\"1\" start=\"0\">
                        <li>Spell Tomes
                            <ol type=\"1\" start=\"0\">
                                <li class=\"docs_textDiagram_repeatable\">Some Spell Tome (Repeatable)</li>
                                <li class=\"docs_textDiagram_repeatable\">Some Spell Tome (Repeatable)</li>
                                <li class=\"docs_textDiagram_repeatable\">Some Spell Tome (Repeatable)</li>
                            </ol>
                        </li>
                        <li>Spells
                            <ol type=\"1\" start=\"0\">
                                <li class=\"docs_textDiagram_repeatable\">Matching Spell (repeatable)</li>
                                <li class=\"docs_textDiagram_repeatable\">Matching Spell (repeatable)</li>
                                <li class=\"docs_textDiagram_repeatable\">Matching Spell (repeatable)</li>
                            </ol>
                        </li>
                        <li>Prerequisite Spells
                            <ol type=\"1\" start=\"0\">
                                <li>Spell 0's Prerequisites
                                    <ul type=\"square\">
                                        <li>Single Spell</li>
                                        <li>Requirements List
                                            <ul type=\"circle\">
                                                <li class=\"docs_textDiagram_repeatable\">Some Spell (Repeatable)</li>
                                                <li class=\"docs_textDiagram_repeatable\">Some Spell (Repeatable)</li>
                                                <li class=\"docs_textDiagram_repeatable\">Some Spell (Repeatable)</li>
                                            </ul>
                                        </li>
                                    </ul>
                                </li>
                                <li>Spell 1's Prerequisites
                                    <ul type=\"square\">
                                        <li>Single Spell</li>
                                        <li>Requirements List
                                            <ul type=\"circle\">
                                                <li class=\"docs_textDiagram_repeatable\">Some Spell (Repeatable)</li>
                                                <li class=\"docs_textDiagram_repeatable\">Some Spell (Repeatable)</li>
                                                <li class=\"docs_textDiagram_repeatable\">Some Spell (Repeatable)</li>
                                            </ul>
                                        </li>
                                    </ul>
                                </li>
                                <li>Spell 2's Prerequisites
                                    <ul type=\"square\">
                                        <li>Single Spell</li>
                                        <li>Requirements List
                                            <ul type=\"circle\">
                                                <li class=\"docs_textDiagram_repeatable\">Some Spell (Repeatable)</li>
                                                <li class=\"docs_textDiagram_repeatable\">Some Spell (Repeatable)</li>
                                                <li class=\"docs_textDiagram_repeatable\">Some Spell (Repeatable)</li>
                                            </ul>
                                        </li>
                                    </ul>
                                </li>
                            </ol>
                        </li>
                        <li>Spells
                            <ol type=\"1\" start=\"0\">
                                <li class=\"docs_textDiagram_repeatable\">Skill Level Global (repeatable)</li>
                                <li class=\"docs_textDiagram_repeatable\">Skill Level Global (repeatable)</li>
                                <li class=\"docs_textDiagram_repeatable\">Skill Level Global (repeatable)</li>
                            </ol>
                        </li>
                    </ol>
                </li>
            </ul>
        </li>
    </ul>
</div>

<h2>Package??!</h2>
<p>
    A quick look in xEdit shows that the template includes an AI Package??! What in the world? Well, allow me to enlighten you. I've used the Package to hold the script needed to install your plugin. Why not use a Quest, you might ask. Well, I've heard reports about the OnInit() event having oddities and inconsistencies on Quests, and so I opted for another form that can hold scripts—and opted for packages. Because they're not a base object (like an Activator or Static), I don't expect xSE plugins to mess with it (causing a very minor performance hit). And because of its EditorID, I don't expect users to attempt to apply it to an NPC.
</p>

<h1>The Guide</h1>
<p>
    Alright, so now you know what that's all about. You may even understand this enough to jump in right now! But if you're not, here's what you do:
    <ol>
        <li>Rename the plugin file. Don't want a bunch of plugins all called <code>LinearSpellProgression Plugin Template.esp</code>, now do we?</li>
        <li>Open the Plugin Template, alongside any plugins you want to add spell prerequisites to, in either <a href=\"https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrimspecialedition/mods/164/\">SSEEdit</a> (Recommended) or the Creation Kit.</li>
        <li>Navigate to the FormLists. If you're doing this in the Creation Kit, you can search by <code>LSP_</code></li>
        <li>Rename the FormLists using the <a href=\"#editorid-scheme\">EditorID Scheme</a> below</li>
        <li>Balance to your heart's content! Here's how:
            <ol type=\"1\">
                <li>Find your Spell Tome. Add it to the Tomes list.</li>
                <li>Add its corresponding Spell to the Spells list</li>
                <li>Add its prerequisites to the Prerequisites list. This can be <b><u>EITHER</u></b> a FormList <b>or</b> a single Spell</li>
            </ol>
            <br />
            Do note these items' indexes must align. So if the Spell Tome for Fireball is at index 2, the spell Fireball should be at index 2 in the Spells list and the various prerequisites should be at index 2 in the Prerequisites lists.
        </li>
    </ol>
    Simple enough, right? (if you don't think so, think of how annoying this would be to implement on your own)
</p>

<h1>EditorID Scheme</h1>

It's a (relatively) simple system.

<ul>

<li>
    Universal Ending: <span class=nested_code><code>[DLC/CC/MOD]</code>{{3-letter abbreviation for author, such as BGS}}<code>_</code>{{2-Digit Number}}{{Human-readable name}}</span><br />
    <i>Example: <code>DLC_BGS_00Skyrim</code></i>
    <br /><br />
</li>
<li>
    Plugin-Level: <span class=nested_code><code>LSP_Main_</code> + Universal Ending</span><br />
    <i>Example: <code>LSP_0Tomes_DLC_BGS_00Skyrim</code></i>
    <br /><br />
</li>
<li>
    Tome: <span class=nested_code><code>LSP_0Tomes_</code> + Universal Ending</span><br />
    <i>Example: <code>LSP_0Tomes_DLC_BGS_00Skyrim</code></i>
    <br /><br />
</li>
<li>
    * Spells: <span class=nested_code><code>LSP_1Spells_</code> + Universal Ending</span><br />
    <i>Example: <code>LSP_1Spells_DLC_BGS_00Skyrim</code></i>
    <br /><br />
</li>
<li>
    Prerequisites: <span class=nested_code><code>LSP_2Pre_</code> + Universal Ending</span><br />
    <i>Example: <code>LSP_2Pre_DLC_BGS_00Skyrim</code></i>
    <br /><br />
</li>
<li>
    List of a single spell's prerequisites: <span class=nested_code><code>LSP_</code>{{Spell Name}}<code>_</code> + Universal Ending</span><br />
    <i>Example: <code>LSP_FlameCloak_DLC_BGS_00Skyrim</code></i>
</li>
</ul>

","description":"The FOMOD Builder is a tool for creating FOMOD installers, a popular XML-based format for video game mod installers. It is the first of its kind to feature intuitive tooltips, dark mode, and eventually more. It is, at this time, incomplete.
","permalink":"/tools/fomod/","lastMod":"2023-3-13","redirect_from":["/tools/fomod/builder/","/tools/fomod-builder/"],"content":"{% capture vortexSVG %}{% link assets/site/images/SVGs/Vortex.svg %}{% endcapture %}
{% capture mo2SVG %}{% link assets/site/images/SVGs/MO2.svg %}{% endcapture %}

<div hidden id=\"lazy-styles\">
    \"{% link assets/site/css/vortex_fomod.css %}\"
</div>

<template id=\"builder-settings-toggle\">
    <label data-setting-display=\"id\" data-setting-filter=\"bool\" class=\"mdl-switch mdl-js-switch mdl-js-ripple-effect\">
        <input type=\"checkbox\" class=\"mdl-switch__input\" data-setting-display=\"checkbox\">
        <span class=\"mdl-switch__label\" data-setting-display=\"label\"></span>
    </label>
    <div data-setting-display=\"id\" data-setting-filter=\"string\" class=\"item-with-fake-label item-with-fake-label--one-liner\"><h4 data-setting-display=\"label\"></h4>
        <button type=\"button\" class=\"mdl-button mdl-js-button mdl-button--raised mdl-js-ripple-effect\"><span class=\"bcd-dropdown_value\">ERROR</span></button>
        <menu data-setting-display=\"dropdown\" class=\"mdl-menu mdl-menu--bottom-left\"></menu>
    </div>
</template>

<template id=\"builder-main-steps-delete-button\">
    <button type=\"button\"
        class=\"mdl-button mdl-js-button mdl-button--fab mdl-js-ripple-effect builder-steps-remove-btn\"
        style=\"width:32px;min-width:32px;height:32px;opacity:0.1;pointer-events:none;\" disabled aria-disabled=\"true\">
            <i class=\"material-icons\" style=\"font-size:75%;font-variation-settings:'FILL' 0,\">
                delete
            </i>
    </button>
</template>

<template id=\"builder-main-steps-drag-handle\">
    <i class=\"material-icons builder-steps-drag-handle\">
        drag_indicator
    </i>
</template>

<template id=\"builder-main-steps-step\">
    <div class=\"builder-steps-step\">

        <!-- Step Summary -->
        <div class=\"builder-steps-step-sum js-bcd-summary adjacent\">
            <i class=\"material-icons open-icon-90CC\">expand_more</i>
            <h1 class=\"h3 builder-steps-step-title\">Step: \"<span class=\"name\"></span>\"</h1>
            <sub><span class=\"builder-steps-step-group-count\" unitWord=\"Group\">ERROR</span>, <span class=\"builder-steps-step-option-count\" unitWord=\"Option\">ERROR</span></sub>
        </div>

        <!-- Step Body -->
        <div class=\"builder-steps-step-body js-bcd-details adjacent\" data-margin-top=\"8px\">

            <div class=\"builder-steps-body-left builder-steps-body-left--enforce-width\">
                <!-- Step Name -->
                <div class=\"item-with-fake-label\"><h2 class=\"h4\">Step Name</h2>
                    <input class=\"builder-steps-step-name bcd-builder-input\" placeholder=\"Step Name\" value=\"ERROR\" />
                </div>

                <!-- Group Sorting Order -->

                </div>

<template id=\"builder-main-steps-option\">
    <div class=\"builder-steps-option\">

            <i class=\"material-icons open-icon-90CC\">expand_more</i>
            <h3 class=\"h4 builder-steps-option-title\">Option: \"<span class=\"name\"></span>\"</h3>
            <sub><span class=\"builder-steps-option-file-count\" unitWord=\"Install\">ERROR</span>, <span class=\"builder-steps-option-flag-count\" unitWord=\"Flag\">ERROR</span></sub>

                </div>

                <!-- Option Description -->

                    <menu class=\"bcd-dropdown-option-state mdl-menu mdl-menu--bottom-left mdl-js-ripple-effect\"></menu>
                </div>

                <button type=\"button\" class=\"mdl-button mdl-js-button mdl-button--raised mdl-button--colored mdl-js-ripple-effect builder-steps-condition-edit-btn\">

                <!-- Condition Flags -->

<!--
    MO2 - Info.xml
    https://github.com/Holt59/mo2-merge/blob/master/plugins/installer_fomod/src/fomodinstallerdialog.cpp#L626-L639

    MO2 - ModuleConfig.xml
    https://github.com/Holt59/mo2-merge/blob/master/plugins/installer_fomod/src/fomodinstallerdialog.cpp#L1226-L1253



    Vortex - Info.xml
    https://github.com/Nexus-Mods/Vortex/blob/master/src/extensions/installer_fomod/index.ts#L177-L200

    Vortex - ModuleConfig.xml
    https://github.com/Nexus-Mods/fomod-installer
-->

<dialog id=\"no-support-modal\" class=\"js-bcd-modal\">
    <div class=\"js-bcd-modal-body\">
        <h1>Support Notice</h1>
        <p>The FOMOD Builder is currently only supported on desktop systems running Chromium-based browsers. While I do eventually plan to provide support for Firefox, Safari, and the like, Chromium-based browsers include powerful web APIs for things like <a href=\"https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/File_System_Access_API\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noreferrer noopener\">manipulation of files and directories</a> that the FOMOD Builder relies on at the moment. In the future, support for other browsers maybe added.</p>
        <br />
        <br />
        <p>Your browser does not support at least one of the APIs tested. Please use a different browser. You may still exit this dialog and attempt to use the FOMOD Builder, however BellCube makes no guarantees as to whether or not it will work.</p>
        <hr />
        <h2> Missing APIs: </h2>
        <p class=\"replace_me_txt\"></p>
    </div>

    <div autofocus class=\"js-bcd-modal-buttons\">
        <button class=\"js-bcd-modal-close mdl-button mdl-js-button mdl-js-ripple-effect mdl-button--raised mdl-button--colored\" width=\"128\">Close</button>
    </div>
</dialog>

<dialog id=\"opening-other-project-modal\" class=\"js-bcd-modal\">
    <div class=\"js-bcd-modal-body\">
        <h1>Opening Another Project</h1>
        <p>Are you sure you want to open another project? There is already one open!</p>
    </div>

    <div autofocus class=\"js-bcd-modal-buttons\">
        <button class=\"js-bcd-modal-close mdl-button mdl-js-button mdl-js-ripple-effect mdl-button--raised mdl-button--colored\" data-modal-message=\"confirm\" width=\"256\">Open Another Project</button>
        <button class=\"js-bcd-modal-close mdl-button mdl-js-button mdl-js-ripple-effect mdl-button--raised mdl-button--colored\" data-modal-message=\"deny\" width=\"192\">Take Me Back</button>
    </div>
</dialog>

<!-- Holds the Tab buttons, which are filled in by JavaScript magic
     Enabled once the user opens a FOMOD
-->
<div id=\"tablist\" role=\"tablist\" class=\"tabs-list-container tabs-list-container--hidden\" disabled>
    <button role=\"tab\" class=\"js-tab-list-button mdl-button mdl-js-ripple-effect\" name=\"Management\"></button>
    <button role=\"tab\" class=\"js-tab-list-button mdl-button mdl-js-ripple-effect\" name=\"Metadata\"></button>
    <button role=\"tab\" class=\"js-tab-list-button mdl-button mdl-js-ripple-effect\" name=\"Steps\"></button>
    <button role=\"tab\" class=\"js-tab-list-button mdl-button mdl-js-ripple-effect\" name=\"Installations\"></button>
</div>

<div class=\"tabs-content-container\"><div> <!-- Holds the Tabs' content -->

    <div role=\"tabpanel\" class=\"tab-content\" name=\"Management\">
        <div id=\"manage-fomod-container\">
            <button onclick=\"window.FOMODBuilder.ui.openFolder()\"
                type=\"button\"
                class=\"mdl-button mdl-js-button mdl-button--raised mdl-button--colored mdl-js-ripple-effect bcd-button-openDir\">

                Select FOMOD Directory
            </button>
                <div class=\"js-bcd-tooltip\" tooltip-relation=\"proceeding\" tooltip-position=\"bottom\"><p>
                    This is the folder that you will put into an archive to be installed by users. If it is not set up for a FOMOD just yet, no worries!
                </p></div>



            <button
                type=\"button\" onclick=\"window.FOMODBuilder.ui.save()\"
                class=\"mdl-button mdl-js-button mdl-button--raised mdl-button--colored mdl-js-ripple-effect bcd-button-save\">

                Save
            </button>



            <button
                type=\"button\" onclick=\"window.FOMODBuilder.ui.cleanSave()\"
                class=\"mdl-button mdl-js-button mdl-button--raised mdl-button--colored mdl-js-ripple-effect bcd-button-save\">

                Clean Save
            </button>
                    <div class=\"js-bcd-tooltip\" tooltip-relation=\"proceeding\" tooltip-position=\"bottom\"><p>
                        Will nuke your current file and reconstruct it from the ground up. This can be dangerous if you've manually commented on the file, however it also ensures that the FOMOD is schema-compliant—which can fix most instances of Vortex rejecting the installer due to non-compliance.
                    </p></div>



            <button disabled=\"visual\"
                type=\"button\" onclick=\"window.FOMODBuilder.ui.attemptRepair()\"
                class=\"mdl-button w192 mr8 mdl-js-button mdl-button--raised mdl-button--colored mdl-js-ripple-effect\">

                Attempt FOMOD Repair
            </button>
                <div class=\"js-bcd-tooltip\" tooltip-relation=\"proceeding\" tooltip-position=\"bottom\"><p>
                    Will attempt to repair a FOMOD that is not schema-compliant. Will try to fix typos in the XML and remove elements that do not appear to be typos.

                    THIS IS DANGEROUS! MAKE A BACKUP AND USE AT YOUR OWN RISK!
                </p></div>

            <br />
            <button onclick=\"window.FOMODBuilder.ui.openFolder(true)\"
                type=\"button\"
                class=\"mdl-button mdl-js-button mdl-button--raised mdl-button--colored mdl-js-ripple-effect bcd-button-openDir\"
                style=\"width:15pc\"
            >
                Load TEST FOMOD
            </button>
                <div class=\"js-bcd-tooltip\" tooltip-relation=\"proceeding\" tooltip-position=\"bottom\"><p>
                    Explore the FOMOD Builder in all its glory, no folder required! This will load a test FOMOD that is included with the program.
                    It may well be possible to use this on an unsupported browser; however, it is not recommended.
                </p></div>
        </div>
        <div id=\"settings-container\" class=\"js-settings-grid\" hidden data-templateID=\"builder-settings-toggle\" data-settingsPath=\"FOMODBuilder.storage.settings\">
            {{ site.data.SettingsMaps.FOMODBuilder | jsonify | escape }}
        </div>
    </div>
    <div role=\"tabpanel\" class=\"tab-content\" name=\"Metadata\">
        <p>Tab: Metadata</p>
        <div id=\"metadata-container\">
            <div id=\"metadata-mod-name\" class=\"mdl-textfield mdl-js-textfield mdl-textfield--floating-label\" tabindex=\"-1\">
                <input class=\"mdl-textfield__input\" type=\"text\" value=\"ERROR\">
                <label class=\"mdl-textfield__label\">Mod Name</label>
            </div>

            <div id=\"metadata-mod-id\" class=\"mdl-textfield mdl-js-textfield mdl-textfield--floating-label\" tabindex=\"-1\">
                <input class=\"mdl-textfield__input\" type=\"number\" pattern=\"\d+\" value=\"ERROR\">
                <label class=\"mdl-textfield__label\">Mod ID</label>
            </div>
            <div class=\"js-bcd-tooltip\" tooltip-relation=\"proceeding\" tooltip-position=\"bottom\"><p>
                This field is not technically used by Mod Organizer 2 or Vortex. That said, MO2's parser does assign the value to an unused variable that shares a name with the Nexus Mods Page ID elsewhere in its code.
                </p> <br><hr><br> <p>
                This value must be a whole number. It is recommended that you create a mod page and use the page's Nexus Mods ID for this field.
            </p></div>

            <div id=\"metadata-mod-author\" class=\"mdl-textfield mdl-js-textfield mdl-textfield--floating-label\" tabindex=\"-1\">
                <input class=\"mdl-textfield__input\" type=\"text\" value=\"ERROR\">
                <label class=\"mdl-textfield__label\">Mod Author</label>
            </div>
            <div class=\"js-bcd-tooltip\" tooltip-relation=\"proceeding\" tooltip-position=\"bottom\"><p>
                The author of the mod.
                </p> <br><hr><br> <p>
                This value is only read and displayed during FOMOD installation by Mod Organizer 2. It is not used by Vortex.
            </p></div>

            <div id=\"metadata-mod-version\" class=\"mdl-textfield mdl-js-textfield mdl-textfield--floating-label\" tabindex=\"-1\">
                <input class=\"mdl-textfield__input\" type=\"version\" value=\"ERROR\">
                <label class=\"mdl-textfield__label\">Mod Version</label>
            </div>
            <div class=\"js-bcd-tooltip\" tooltip-relation=\"proceeding\" tooltip-position=\"bottom\"><p>
                The version of the mod. I suggest using <a href=\"https://semver.org/\">Semantic Versioning</a> (aka SemVer) for this field.
                </p> <br><hr><br> <p>
                This value is only read and displayed during FOMOD installation by Mod Organizer 2. It is not used by Vortex.
            </p></div>

            <div id=\"metadata-mod-url\" class=\"mdl-textfield mdl-js-textfield mdl-textfield--floating-label\" tabindex=\"-1\">
                <input class=\"mdl-textfield__input\" type=\"url\" pattern=\"^([a-z0-9+.-]+):(?:\/\/(?:((?:[a-z0-9-._~!$&'()*+,;=:]|%[0-9A-F]{2})*)@)?((?:[a-z0-9-._~!$&'()*+,;=]|%[0-9A-F]{2})*)(?::(\d*))?(\/(?:[a-z0-9-._~!$&'()*+,;=:@\/]|%[0-9A-F]{2})*)?|(\/?(?:[a-z0-9-._~!$&'()*+,;=:@]|%[0-9A-F]{2})+(?:[a-z0-9-._~!$&'()*+,;=:@\/]|%[0-9A-F]{2})*)?)(?:\?((?:[a-z0-9-._~!$&'()*+,;=:\/?@]|%[0-9A-F]{2})*))?(?:#(?:[a-z0-9-._~!$&'()*+,;=:\/?@]|%[0-9A-F]{2})*)?$\" value=\"ERROR\">
                <label class=\"mdl-textfield__label\">Website</label>
                <span class=\"mdl-textfield__error\">If specified, this should be a valid URI</span>
            </div>
            <div class=\"js-bcd-tooltip\" tooltip-relation=\"proceeding\" tooltip-position=\"bottom\"><p>
                A link to the mod's website.
                </p><br><hr><p>
                This value is only read and accessible as a hyperlink during FOMOD installation by Mod Organizer 2. It is not used by Vortex.
            </p></div>
        </div>
    </div>



    <div role=\"tabpanel\" class=\"tab-content\" name=\"Steps\">

        <div class=\"item-with-fake-label\" style=\"margin:0 auto;margin-bottom:24px;align-items:center;\">
            <label style=\"font-size:large\">Choose Your Editor Style:</label>
            <div>
                <button type=\"button\" id=\"bcd-stepBTN-builder\" onclick=\"window.FOMODBuilder.ui.setStepEditorType('builder')\" class=\"mdl-button w192 mr8 mdl-js-button mdl-button--raised mdl-button--colored mdl-js-ripple-effect\">
                    FOMOD Builder
                </button>

                <button    disabled=\"visual\"    type=\"button\" id=\"bcd-stepBTN-vortex\" onclick=\"window.FOMODBuilder.ui.setStepEditorType('vortex')\" class=\"mdl-button w192 mr8 mdl-js-button mdl-button--raised mdl-button--colored mdl-js-ripple-effect\">
                    Vortex
                </button>

                <button    disabled=\"visual\"    type=\"button\" id=\"bcd-stepBTN-mo2\" onclick=\"window.FOMODBuilder.ui.setStepEditorType('mo2')\" class=\"mdl-button w192 mr8 mdl-js-button mdl-button--raised mdl-button--colored mdl-js-ripple-effect\">
                    Mod Organizer 2
                </button>
            </div>
        </div>







        <div id=\"steps-builder-container\" class=\"fomod-editor-type\">
            <div>

                <!-- Left Column -->
                <div class=\"builder-steps-body-left\">

                    <!-- Mod Name -->
                    <div class=\"item-with-fake-label\"><h1 class=\"h3\">Mod Name</h1>
                        <input class=\"builder-steps-mod-name bcd-builder-input\" placeholder=\"Mod Name\" value=\"\" />
                    </div>

                    <!-- Steps Sorting Order -->
                    <div class=\"item-with-fake-label item-with-fake-label--one-liner\"><h1 class=\"h3\">Step Sorting Order</h1>
                        <button type=\"button\" class=\"mdl-button mdl-js-button mdl-button--raised mdl-js-ripple-effect\"><span class=\"bcd-dropdown_value\">ERROR</span></button>
                        <menu class=\"bcd-dropdown-sorting-order mdl-menu mdl-menu--bottom-left mdl-js-ripple-effect\"></menu>
                    </div>

                    <!-- FOMOD Conditions -->
                    <button type=\"button\" class=\"mdl-button mdl-js-button mdl-button--raised mdl-button--colored mdl-js-ripple-effect builder-steps-condition-edit-btn\">
                        Edit FOMOD Prerequisites
                    </button>
                </div>


                <!-- Right Column - Mod Image -->
                <div class=\"builder-steps-mod-image\">
                    <img>
                    <div class=\"js-relative-file-picker--container\">
                        <input class=\"bcd-builder-input js-relative-image-picker\" relative-to=\"FOMODBuilder\" placeholder=\"Mod Image Path\" value=\"\" />
                    </div>
                </div>

            </div>

            <!-- Steps Container -->
            <div class=\"builder-steps-steps-container\"></div>

            <button type=\"button\" class=\"mdl-button mdl-js-button mdl-button--raised mdl-button--colored mdl-js-ripple-effect builder-steps-add-child-btn\">
                Add Step
            </button>
        </div>







        <div id=\"steps-vortex-container\" class=\"fomod-editor-type js-vortex-steps\">
            <div id=\"vortex-steps-header\">
                <input class=\"bcd-vortex-input vortex-steps-title vortex-fake-header h4 js-dynamic-textarea-width\" paddingPX=20 placeholder=\"Mod Name\" value=\"Retexture for The Scroll\" />
                <br /><input class=\"bcd-vortex-input vortex-modal-subtitle js-dynamic-textarea-width\" paddingPX=20 placeholder=\"Step Name\" value=\"Choose Version (1/2)\" />
            </div>
            <div class=\"vortex-modal-body\">
                <div class=\"vortex-layout-container vortex-layout-container-row vortex-layout-fill\" type=\"row\" style=\"position: relative; flex-direction: row;\">
                    <div class=\"vortex-layout-flex\">
                        <div class=\"vortex-layout-flex-inner vortex-layout-flex-fill\" style=\"overflow-y: auto;\">
                            <form id=\"vortex-fomod-installer-form\" class=\"vortex-\">

                                <div class=\"vortex-form-group\"> <input class=\"bcd-vortex-input groupTitle js-dynamic-textarea-width\" paddingPX=20 placeholder=\"Group Name\" value=\"Choose Version\" />

                                    <div class=\"vortex-radio\"><label>
                                        <input name=\"0\" type=\"radio\">
                                        <input class=\"bcd-vortex-input option js-dynamic-textarea-width\" paddingPX=20 placeholder=\"Option Name\" value=\"Single Texture\" />
                                    </label></div>

                                    <div class=\"vortex-radio\"><label>
                                        <input name=\"0\" type=\"radio\">
                                        <input class=\"bcd-vortex-input option js-dynamic-textarea-width\" paddingPX=20 placeholder=\"Option Name\" value=\"Single Set\" />
                                    </label></div>

                                    <div class=\"vortex-radio\"><label>
                                        <input name=\"0\" type=\"radio\">
                                        <input class=\"bcd-vortex-input option js-dynamic-textarea-width\" paddingPX=20 placeholder=\"Option Name\" value=\"Mixed Set (Preset)\" />
                                    </label></div>

                                </div>

                                <div class=\"vortex-form-group\"> <input class=\"bcd-vortex-input groupTitle js-dynamic-textarea-width\" paddingPX=20 placeholder=\"Group Name\" value=\"Description\" />
                                    <div class=\"vortex-checkbox vortex-disabled\"><label>
                                        <input type=\"checkbox\">
                                        <input class=\"bcd-vortex-input option js-dynamic-textarea-width\" paddingPX=20 placeholder=\"Option Name\" value=\"Description\" />
                                    </label></div>
                                </div>

                                <div class=\"vortex-form-group\"> <input class=\"bcd-vortex-input groupTitle js-dynamic-textarea-width\" paddingPX=20 placeholder=\"Group Name\" value=\"SKSE\" />
                                    <div class=\"vortex-checkbox\"><label>
                                        <input type=\"checkbox\">
                                        <input class=\"bcd-vortex-input option js-dynamic-textarea-width\" paddingPX=20 placeholder=\"Option Name\" value=\"Enable SKSE Modules (Preset)\" />
                                    </label></div>
                                </div>
                                <div class=\"vortex-form-group\"> <input class=\"bcd-vortex-input groupTitle js-dynamic-textarea-width\" paddingPX=20 placeholder=\"Group Name\" value=\"Recommendations\" />
                                    <div class=\"vortex-checkbox\"><label>
                                        <input type=\"checkbox\">
                                        <input class=\"bcd-vortex-input option js-dynamic-textarea-width\" paddingPX=20 placeholder=\"Option Name\" value=\"Author's Recommendations (Preset)\" />
                                    </label></div>
                                </div>

                                <div class=\"vortex-form-group\"> <input class=\"bcd-vortex-input groupTitle js-dynamic-textarea-width\" paddingPX=20 placeholder=\"Group Name\" value=\"Banana Types\" />

                                    <div class=\"vortex-checkbox\"><label>
                                        <input id=\"vortex-checkbox-0-0-0\" type=\"checkbox\" checked=\"\">
                                        <input class=\"bcd-vortex-input option js-dynamic-textarea-width\" paddingPX=20 placeholder=\"Option Name\" value=\"1700s\" />
                                    </label></div>

                                    <div class=\"vortex-checkbox\"><label>
                                        <input id=\"vortex-checkbox-0-0-1\" type=\"checkbox\" checked=\"\">
                                        <input class=\"bcd-vortex-input option js-dynamic-textarea-width\" paddingPX=20 placeholder=\"Option Name\" value=\"Australian\" />
                                    </label></div>

                                    <div class=\"vortex-checkbox\"><label>
                                        <input id=\"vortex-checkbox-0-0-2\" type=\"checkbox\">
                                        <input class=\"bcd-vortex-input option js-dynamic-textarea-width\" paddingPX=20 placeholder=\"Option Name\" value=\"Modern Worldwide\" />
                                    </label></div>

                                    <div class=\"vortex-checkbox\"><label>
                                        <input id=\"vortex-checkbox-0-0-3\" type=\"checkbox\">
                                        <input class=\"bcd-vortex-input option js-dynamic-textarea-width\" paddingPX=20 placeholder=\"Option Name\" value=\"Purple Bananas\" />
                                    </label></div>

                                    <div class=\"vortex-checkbox vortex-disabled\"><label title=\"hardcoded\">
                                        <input id=\"vortex-checkbox-0-0-4\" type=\"checkbox\" disabled=\"\">
                                        <input class=\"bcd-vortex-input option js-dynamic-textarea-width\" paddingPX=20 placeholder=\"Option Name\" value=\"Brown Bananas\" />
                                    </label></div>

                                </div>
                                <div class=\"vortex-form-group\"><input class=\"bcd-vortex-input groupTitle js-dynamic-textarea-width\" paddingPX=20 placeholder=\"Group Name\" value=\"Banana Textures\" />

                                    <div class=\"vortex-radio\"><label>
                                        <input id=\"vortex-radio-0-1-0\" name=\"1\" type=\"radio\">
                                        <input class=\"bcd-vortex-input option js-dynamic-textarea-width\" paddingPX=20 placeholder=\"Option Name\" value=\"Base 1024x1024\" />
                                    </label></div>

                                    <div class=\"vortex-radio\"><label>
                                        <input id=\"vortex-radio-0-1-1\" name=\"1\" type=\"radio\" checked=\"\">
                                        <input class=\"bcd-vortex-input option js-dynamic-textarea-width\" paddingPX=20 placeholder=\"Option Name\" value=\"2048x2048\" />
                                    </label></div>

                                    <div class=\"vortex-radio\"><label>
                                        <input id=\"vortex-radio-0-1-2\" name=\"1\" type=\"radio\">
                                        <input class=\"bcd-vortex-input option js-dynamic-textarea-width\" paddingPX=20 placeholder=\"Option Name\" value=\"4096x4096\" />
                                    </label></div>

                                    <div class=\"vortex-radio\"><label>
                                        <input id=\"vortex-radio-0-1-3\" name=\"1\" type=\"radio\">
                                        <input class=\"bcd-vortex-input option js-dynamic-textarea-width\" paddingPX=20 placeholder=\"Option Name\" value=\"128x128\" />
                                    </label></div>

                                    <div class=\"vortex-radio vortex-disabled\"><label title=\"hardcoded\">
                                        <input id=\"vortex-radio-0-1-4\" name=\"1\" type=\"radio\" disabled=\"\">
                                        <input class=\"bcd-vortex-input option js-dynamic-textarea-width\" paddingPX=20 placeholder=\"Option Name\" value=\"0x0\" />
                                    </label></div>

                                </div>

                                <div class=\"vortex-layout-fixed\" style=\"max-width: 60%; min-width: 40%; overflow-y: auto;\">
                                    <div class=\"vortex-layout-container vortex-layout-container-column vortex-layout-fill\" type=\"column\" style=\"flex-direction: column;\">

                                        <div class=\"vortex-layout-flex\"><div class=\"vortex-layout-flex-inner\"> <div class=\"vortex-installer-image\">
                                            <img src=\"/assets/site/images/example-image.png\" class=\"vortex-zoomable-image\">
                                        </div></div></div>

                                        <div class=\"vortex-layout-flex vortex-description-outer\"><div class=\"vortex-description vortex-layout-flex-inner vortex-layout-flex-fill\">
                                                <label readonly=\"\" class=\"vortex-control-label\">Bananas from the 1700s were vastly different from what we see on the shelves today!</label>
                                        </div></div>

                                    </div>
                                </div>

                            </form>
                        </div>
                    </div>
                    <div class=\"vortex-layout-fixed\" style=\"max-width: 60%; min-width: 40%; overflow-y: auto;\">

                                <textarea class=\"bcd-vortex-input description js-dynamic-textarea-height\" title=\"Option Description\" placeholder=\"Option Description\">
                                    Some form of description, whatever that may entail. Don't ask me 🤷‍♂️

                </div>
            </div>

            <div id=\"vortex-steps-footer\">

                    </div>

                <div>

                        Choose Texture (2/2)

With complexity increases exponentially with ease of use, and so it stands that Linear Spell Progression is relatively complex. This page endevours to explain its inner-workings
","content":"<h1> How It Works - For Nerds </h1>

Linear Spell Progression consumes and stores data in a structure of FormLists intended to represent Objects and Arrays in developed, object-oriented programming languages.
","dir":"/documentation/linear-spell-progression/how-it-works/","name":"how-it-works.html","path":"documentation/linear-spell-progression/how-it-works.html","url":"/documentation/linear-spell-progression/how-it-works/"},{"layout":"page","title":"The Home of A Decent Hobbyist Programmer","sitemap":false,"content":"","dir":"/tools/","name":"index.html","path":"tools/index.html","url":"/tools/"},{"layout":"page","title":"Home","formatted_title":"BellCube - A Decent Hobbyist Programmer","lastMod":"2023-3-13","isArticle":true,"description":"The website for BellCube, a hobbyist video game modder and web developer. The site hosts documentation, tools, and project updates—and possibly the occasional blog post. Best of all, it's all open-source!
BellCube can be found on GitHub and Nexus Mods as well.
","extra_head":"<link rel=\"preconnect\" href=\"https://github.com\">
","content":"<h1>Hello there!</h1>
<p>
    I'm BellCube, a modder who works on Minecraft and various Bethesda games.
    <br /><br />
    This is my personal website—a place where I post documentation, tools, and updates on my projects. Maybe the occasional blog post? 🤷‍♂️
    <br /><br />
    You can find some fancy links in the Navigation Drawer to the left. A full-blown \"About Me,\" a section for Documentation, and some links to my GitHub and Nexus Mods profiles (hover your mouse over the Nexus Mods one for a treat!).
</p>

<br />
<hr />
<br />

<div class=\"centered\"> {% include projects.html %} </div>
","dir":"/","name":"index.html","path":"index.html","url":"/"},{"layout":"docs","navType":"LSProgression","title":"Linear Spell Progression","permalink":"/documentation/linear-spell-progression/","redirect_from":["/documentation/linear-spell-progression"],"lastMod":"2022-11-23","description":"Linear Spell Progression is a Skyrim Special Edition framework mod that allows you to add prerequisites to spells without creating compatibility issues.
","content":"<h1>Linear Spell Progression</h1>

Linear Spell Progression (LSP) is a framework developed by me, BellCube Dev, for easily and conflictlessly adding spell prerequisites. You can read about <a href=\"{% link documentation/linear-spell-progression/how-it-works.html %}\">How It Works - For Nerds</a> or <a href=\"{% link documentation/linear-spell-progression/linear-spell-progression.html %}\">Creating a Plugin</a> here on this wiki.

<h2>Compatibility</h2>

<i>tl;dr: This is probably the most compatible mod with a plugin in your entire load order</i>
<br />
Linear Spell Progression is designed in every aspect to be as compatible as possible. It makes a grand total of zero record overrides (in laymen's terms, it does not edit anything directly), it does not require any DLC, and it only takes action when directed to by other plugins.

<h2>Creating LSP Plugins</h2>

Designed with modularity in mind, LSP plugins are as simple to create as the engine allows, and can easily be done entirely through xEdit. See  <a href=\"{% link documentation/linear-spell-progression/creating-a-plugin.html %}\">the full guide</a> for the full run-down.
","dir":"/documentation/linear-spell-progression/","name":"linear-spell-progression.html","path":"documentation/linear-spell-progression/linear-spell-progression.html","url":"/documentation/linear-spell-progression/"},{"layout":"page","title":"Tools - Papyrus Auto Docs","extra_head":"<script async type=\"module\" src=\"papyrus-docs.js\" onload=\"callInit('papyDocs')\"></script>
","lastMod":"2022-11-23","description":"The Papyrus Auto Docs tool generates Markdown documentation for Papyrus scripts largely automatically. It includes options for both batch processing and single-file processing.
","permalink":"/tools/papyrus/markdown-docs/","redirect_from":["/tools/papy/markdown-docs/","/tools/papyrus/docs/","/tools/papy/docs/","/tools/papyrus/markdown/","/tools/papy/markdown/","/tools/papyrus/md-docs/","/tools/papy/md-docs/","/tools/papyrus-markdown-docs/","/tools/papy-markdown-docs/","/tools/papyrus/docs/","/tools/papy/docs/","/tools/papyrus/markdown/","/tools/papy/markdown/","/tools/papyrus/md-docs/","/tools/papy/md-docs/"],"content":"<h1>Papyrus Markdown Docs Generator</h1>
<p>This page is a utility for generating bare-bones Markdown documentation for Papyrus scripts.
<br />
It can either process a single file and output the Markdown below—<b><i>or</i></b> it can process an entire directory recursively, outputting the Markdown as files by the same name, but with the <code>md</code> extension appended.
<br />
This page was build with generating documentation for <a href=\"https://modding.wiki\" target=\"_blank\">Modding.wiki</a> in mind.</p>
</p>
<div class=\"warning-block\">
    <h3 style=\"margin-bottom:2px\">IMPORTANT:</h3>
    <p>This tool is currently only intended for use with Skyrim Papyrus scripts. Fallout 4 Papyrus support may come at a later date.</p>
</div>
<div class=\"danger-block\">
    <h3 style=\"margin-bottom:2px\">WARNING:</h3>
    <p>DO NOT simply copy-paste to the wiki! To provide coherent documentation, you should review each element with care. No generator is perfect, and programmers infamously do not document their code. The documentation extracted here may be lacking or even non-existent.</p>
</div>

<button id=\"papy_docs_folder-picker\" type=\"button\" style=\"width:160px;margin-right:8px;\" class=\"mdl-button mdl-js-button mdl-button--raised mdl-button--colored mdl-js-ripple-effect bcd-button-openDir\">
    Select Directory
</button>
<div class=\"js-bcd-tooltip\" tooltip-relation=\"proceeding\" tooltip-position=\"bottom\"><p>
    Select an entire directory for batch processing. <code>.psc</code> files will be parsed and the documentation will be outputted as <code>.psc.md</code> files alongside the original files. WILL overwrite existing files.
</p></div>

<button id=\"papy_docs_file-picker\" type=\"button\" style=\"width:118px\" class=\"mdl-button mdl-js-button mdl-button--raised mdl-button--colored mdl-js-ripple-effect bcd-button-openFile\">
    Select File
</button>
<div class=\"js-bcd-tooltip\" tooltip-relation=\"proceeding\" tooltip-position=\"bottom\"><p>
    Select a single file for processing. The documentation will be outputted in the below text area.
</p></div>

<br />

<div id=\"papy_docs_lib-Name_cont\" class=\"mdl-textfield mdl-js-textfield mdl-textfield--floating-label\" tabindex=\"-1\">
    <input id=\"papy_docs_lib-Name\" class=\"mdl-textfield__input\" type=\"text\" placeholder=\"Vanilla\">
    <label class=\"mdl-textfield__label\" for=\"papy_docs_lib-Name\">Library Name</label>
</div>
<div class=\"js-bcd-tooltip\" tooltip-relation=\"proceeding\" tooltip-position=\"bottom\"><p>
    The name of the library. For instance, <code>Vanilla</code>.
</p></div>

<div id=\"papy_docs_lib-Link_cont\" class=\"mdl-textfield mdl-js-textfield mdl-textfield--floating-label\" tabindex=\"-1\">
                                                                      <!-- Pattern regex adapted from https://stackoverflow.com/a/30910/13076790 (changes: fix escaping, require starting with '/') -->
    <input id=\"papy_docs_lib-Link\" class=\"mdl-textfield__input\" type=\"url\" pattern=\"^\/((?:[a-z0-9-._~!$&'()*+,;=:@\/]|%[0-9A-F]{2})*)?|(\/?(?:[a-z0-9-._~!$&'()*+,;=:@]|%[0-9A-F]{2})+(?:[a-z0-9-._~!$&'()*+,;=:@\/]|%[0-9A-F]{2})*)?(?:\?((?:[a-z0-9-._~!$&'()*+,;=:\/?@]|%[0-9A-F]{2})*))?(?:#((?:[a-z0-9-._~!$&'()*+,;=:\/?@]|%[0-9A-F]{2})*))?$\"
        placeholder=\"/skyrim/developers/papyrus/concepts/libraries\">
    <label class=\"mdl-textfield__label\" for=\"papy_docs_lib-Link\">Library URL</label>
</div>
<div class=\"js-bcd-tooltip\" tooltip-relation=\"proceeding\" tooltip-position=\"bottom\"><p>
    <i>Modding.wiki</i>-relative URL to the library's folder page.
</p></div>

<div id=\"papy_docs_register-pattern_cont\" class=\"mdl-textfield mdl-js-textfield mdl-textfield--floating-label\" tabindex=\"-1\">
                                                                      <!-- Pattern regex adapted from https://stackoverflow.com/a/30910/13076790 (changes: fix escaping, require starting with '/') -->
    <input id=\"papy_docs_register-pattern\" class=\"mdl-textfield__input\" type=\"text\"
        placeholder=\"RegisterFor%e%\"> <!-- pattern=\"^.*?%e%.*$\" -->
    <label class=\"mdl-textfield__label\" for=\"papy_docs_register-pattern\">Register Function Scheme</label>
</div>
<div class=\"js-bcd-tooltip\" tooltip-relation=\"proceeding\" tooltip-position=\"bottom\"><p>
    Case-insensitive scheme to look for when trying to detect Event Registration functions. <code>%e%</code> is substituted for the event's name (with some words, common prefixes, and common suffixes removed).
    <br /><br />
    The default (<code>RegisterFor%e%</code>) will serve just fine for vanilla.
</p></div>

<pre><code class=\"language-markdown\" id=\"papy_docs_md-output\" onclick=\"\"><span class=\"hljs-section\"># Markdown Output</span>

Here, you'll find the <span class=\"hljs-code\">`Markdown`</span> that you generate from <span class=\"hljs-strong\">**<span class=\"hljs-emphasis\">*single*</span>**</span> files (or the <span class=\"hljs-emphasis\">*last*</span> file in the selected folder) above.

<span class=\"hljs-bullet\">*</span> Thanks to [<span class=\"hljs-string\">highlight_js</span>](<span class=\"hljs-link\">https://highlightjs.org/</span>), we have fancy highlighting here!
</code></pre>
","dir":"/tools/papyrus/markdown-docs/","name":"papyrus-docs.html","path":"tools/papyrus/markdown-docs/papyrus-docs.html","url":"/tools/papyrus/markdown-docs/"},{"layout":"page","title":"Tools - Typescript From Inline Sources","extra_head":"<script async type=\"module\" src=\"ts-from-inline-src.js\" onload=\"callInit('tsFromInline')\"></script>
","lastMod":"2022-6-10","description":"A quick tool to quickly extract TypeScript source code that was emitted into a JavaScript file using the `inlineSources` compile option.
","permalink":"/tools/typescript/from-inline-source/","content":"<h1>Typescript From Inline Sources</h1>
<p>When using the <code>inlineSources</code> compiler option, TypeScript will emit the source code of the file into the JavaScript file as a data URI. This tool will extract the source code from the data URI and display for you, allowing you to easily use it for other things.</p>

<textarea placeholder=\"Data URI or JSON\" style=\"width:100%;height:256px\" class=\"code\" oninput=\"window.fromInline.ui.dataUpdated(event)\"></textarea>

<div id=\"prefab-output\" class=\"hidden\" aria-hidden=\"true\">
    <h3>Example/File.ts</h3>

    <pre><button onclick=\"window.copyCode(this);requestAnimationFrame(this.blur.bind(this));\" class=\"mdl-button mdl-js-button mdl-button--fab mdl-js-ripple-effect\" style='width:32px;min-width:32px;height:32px;'><i class=\"material-icons\" style=\"font-size:75%;font-variation-settings:'FILL' 0,\">content_copy</i></button><code class=\"language-typescript\"><span class=\"hljs-section\">ERROR: This text should not EVER show!</code></pre>
</div>

<h2>Output</h2>
<div id=\"output-area\" site.pages:[{"layout":"page","title":"404 - An Error code!","formatted_title":"<code>404</code> - That's an error code!","description":"yes","sitemap":false,"content":"<h1>Error! Not Found!</h1> <p>Whoops! It looks like something might've been mistyped there. You can try again or take a look at one of the links to the left.</p> <hr /> <h1>Did you know?</h1> <p> <code>404</code> is what we call a \"response status code.\" These codes tell your browser how the server handled your request. Most of the time, your browser gets Status Code 200, which means \"OK\". In other words, the server likes you and it decided to let you see the webpage.<br /> If you've ever attempted to go somewhere where you aren't allowed, your browser likely either received a redirect to a login page, a <code>4xx</code> error code (like <code>401</code> - \"Unauthorized\" or <code>403</code> - \"Forbidden\"), or maybe both.<br /> <br /> And if you've ever sent a requests to a teapot to try and brew coffee, the teapot likely returned a <code>418</code>—the \"I'm a teapot\" error code. Yes, <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Status/418\">that's a real thing.</a><br /> <br /> In this case, it looks like you've stumbled upon <code>404</code>, which means \"Not Found.\" No worries! This can be easily corrected by typing in the correct URL or navigating to it via the <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"/sitemap/\">Sitemap</a> or the navigation bar to the left. </p> ","dir":"/","name":"404.html","path":"404.html","url":"/404.html"},{"layout":"docs","title":"Documentation","permalink":"/documentation/","lastMod":"2022-11-23","redirect_from":["/documentation"],"content":"<p> Why hello there! Documentation for everyone! </p> ","dir":"/documentation/","name":"Documentation.html","path":"documentation/Documentation.html","url":"/documentation/"},{"layout":"compress_html","permalink":"/assets/site/misc/Info.xsd","content":"<?xml version=\"1.0\" encoding=\"UTF-8\" ?> <xs:schema xmlns:xs=\"http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema\"> <xs:element name=\"fomod\"> <xs:complexType> <xs:sequence minOccurs=\"0\" maxOccurs=\"1\"> <xs:element name=\"Name\" minOccurs=\"0\" maxOccurs=\"1\" type=\"xs:string\"> <xs:annotation><xs:documentation><h2>Name of the mod.</h2><br /><br /><hr />Used by:<ul><li>Vortex</li><li>Mod Organizer 2</li></ul><br /><hr /></xs:documentation></xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name=\"Author\" minOccurs=\"0\" maxOccurs=\"1\"> <xs:annotation><xs:documentation><h2>Author of the mod.</h2><br /><br /><hr />Used by:<ul><li>Mod Organizer 2</li></ul><br /><hr /></xs:documentation></xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name=\"Uploader\" minOccurs=\"0\" maxOccurs=\"1\"> <xs:annotation><xs:documentation><h2>Person responsible for uploading the mod.</h2><br />Often will not differ from the Author, however, in certain cases, the author will rely on others to distribute their work. In other cases, an author's username for the website they distrubute the mod on does not match their prefered author name (for instance, if someone prefers to go by a name with spaces but their mod distribution service of choice prevents such characters).<br /><hr /><br />Not used either mainstream mod manager yet.<br /><hr /></xs:documentation></xs:annotation> <xs:complexType> <xs:simpleContent> <xs:extension base=\"xs:anyURI\"> <xs:annotation><xs:documentation> Person responsible for uploading the mod. Often will not differ from the Author, however, in certain cases, the author will rely on others to distribute their work. In other cases, an author's username for the website they distrubute the mod on does not match their prefered author name (for instance, if someone prefers to go by a name with spaces but their mod distribution service of choice prevents such characters).<br /><hr /><br />Not used either mainstream mod manager yet.</xs:documentation></xs:annotation> <xs:attribute name=\"website\" use=\"optional\" type=\"xs:anyURI\"> <xs:annotation><xs:documentation><h2>The website of the uploader.</h2><br /><hr /><br />Not used either mainstream mod manager yet.<br /><hr /></xs:documentation></xs:annotation> </xs:attribute> </xs:extension> </xs:simpleContent> </xs:complexType> </xs:element> <xs:element name=\"Id\" minOccurs=\"0\" maxOccurs=\"1\" type=\"xs:nonNegativeInteger\"> <xs:annotation><xs:documentation><h2>Nexus Mods ID of the mod.</h2><br /><s>Used by MO2 to pull Nexus Mods metadata.</s> The ID appears to be unused after reading, however it <i>does</i> share a variable name with the Nexus ID.<br /><hr /><br />Not <i>actually</i> used either mainstream mod manager yet.</xs:documentation></xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name=\"Website\" minOccurs=\"0\" maxOccurs=\"1\" type=\"xs:anyURI\"> <xs:annotation><xs:documentation><h2>Website URL for the mod.</h2><br />Typically either the mod's main download page or an author-hosted webpage, such as a documentation page with links to the download page(s).<br /><hr /><br />Used by:<ul><li>Mod Organizer 2</li></ul></xs:documentation></xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name=\"Version\" minOccurs=\"0\" maxOccurs=\"1\" type=\"xs:string\"> <xs:annotation><xs:documentation><h2>Version number number of the mod.</h2><br />Ideally, this field (and your mod page) should follow <a href=\"https://semver.org/\">Semantic Versioning</a>.<br /><hr /><br />Used by:<ul><li>Mod Organizer 2</li></ul></xs:documentation></xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name=\"Description\" minOccurs=\"0\" maxOccurs=\"1\"> <xs:annotation><xs:documentation><h2>Description of the mod.</h2><br />Nexus-style BBCode <b>is</b> supported.<br />Equivilent to Nexus Mods' \"Short Description\" field.<br /><hr /><br />Not used either mainstream mod manager yet.</xs:documentation></xs:annotation> <xs:complexType> <xs:simpleContent> <xs:extension base=\"xs:string\"> <xs:annotation><xs:documentation><h2>Person responsible for uploading the mod.</h2><br />Often will not differ from the Author, however, in certain cases, the author will rely on others to distribute their work. In other cases, an author's username for the website they distrubute the mod on does not match their prefered author name (for instance, if someone prefers to go by a name with spaces but their mod distribution service of choice prevents such characters).<br /><hr /><br />Not used either mainstream mod manager yet.</xs:documentation></xs:annotation> <xs:attribute name=\"short\" use=\"optional\" type=\"xs:string\"> <xs:annotation><xs:documentation><h2>Short description for the mod.</h2> Equivilent to Nexus Mods' \"Short Description\" field.<br /><hr /><br />Not used either mainstream mod manager yet.</xs:documentation></xs:annotation> </xs:attribute> </xs:extension> </xs:simpleContent> </xs:complexType> </xs:element> <xs:element name=\"Image\" minOccurs=\"0\" maxOccurs=\"1\" type=\"xs:string\"> <xs:annotation><xs:documentation><h2>Path to the main image file for the mod.</h2> Follows the same format as <code>ModuleConfig.xml</code><br /><hr /><br />Not used either mainstream mod manager yet.</xs:documentation></xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name=\"FileType\" minOccurs=\"0\" maxOccurs=\"1\"> <xs:annotation><xs:documentation><h2>Specifies what type of file this is.</h2>Follows the Nexus Mods format for mod file types.<br /><hr /><br />Not used either mainstream mod manager yet.</xs:documentation></xs:annotation> <xs:simpleType> <xs:restriction base=\"xs:string\"> <xs:enumeration value=\"MAIN\"> <xs:annotation><xs:documentation>File is considered the \"Main\" file for the mod project.</xs:documentation></xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value=\"UPDATE\"> <xs:annotation><xs:documentation>File is considered an <i>update</i> to the Main file.</xs:documentation></xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value=\"OPTIONAL\"> <xs:annotation><xs:documentation>File is considered <i>optional.</i></xs:documentation></xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value=\"MISCELLANEOUS\"> <xs:annotation><xs:documentation>File does not fit into any of the other provided categories.</xs:documentation></xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value=\"ARCHIVED\"> <xs:annotation><xs:documentation>File is considered \"Archived\" and should not be used. This value probably should not be set on a FOMOD unless you know what you're doing.</xs:documentation></xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> </xs:element> <xs:element name=\"CategoryID\" minOccurs=\"0\" maxOccurs=\"1\" type=\"xs:positiveInteger\"> <xs:annotation><xs:documentation><h2>Category ID of the mod.</h2><br />Follows Nexus Mods' Category IDs.<br /><hr /><br />Not used either mainstream mod manager yet.<br /><hr /></xs:documentation></xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name=\"GameID\" minOccurs=\"0\" maxOccurs=\"1\" type=\"xs:positiveInteger\"> <xs:annotation><xs:documentation><h2>Game ID of the mod.</h2> Follows Nexus Mods' Game IDs.<br /><hr /><br />Not used either mainstream mod manager yet.<br /><hr /></xs:documentation></xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> </xs:element> </xs:schema>
